revised_title: Cardiac Function and the Role of Phosphorylation in Contractile Proteins
tldr: This article discusses the role of protein phosphorylation in the regulation of cardiac contractility. The authors focus on the phosphorylation of contractile proteins, such as troponin-I, C-protein, and myosin P-light chain, and their impact on cardiac function. They explain how phosphorylation of these proteins contributes to the increased rate of relaxation and changes in tension development in the heart in response to hormones and pharmacological agents.
